segments.text: I can’t believe how calm the woman is while the sink is overflowing right next to her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her foot is in the water, but she doesn’t even flinch.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think she’s in her own little world, completely unaware of everything around her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is stretching so far to reach those cookies—he’s going to fall!
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The stool is already tilting, and the floor is wet—this is a recipe for disaster.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel like I need to step in and stop this before someone gets hurt.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is just standing there, innocent and excited, not realizing the danger.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The garden outside looks so nice, but inside, everything is falling apart.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if the woman will ever notice the water or the kids.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This is one of those moments where everything is about to go wrong at once.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel bad for the kids because they’re going to be in so much trouble.
segments.speaker: PAR
